sanksheparamayana.title: Sanksepa Ramayana
sanksheparamayana.source: Valmiki Ramayana – Bala Kanda, Sarga 1 (Narada–Valmiki Samvada)
sanksheparamayana.description: Narada Maharshi narrates the entire Ramayana to Sage Valmiki in exactly 100 slokas.

main_characters.name: Rama
main_characters.role: Prince of Ayodhya, avatar of Vishnu, embodiment of dharma.

main_characters.name: Sita
main_characters.role: Wife of Rama, symbol of purity and devotion.

main_characters.name: Hanuman
main_characters.role: Devotee of Rama, symbol of strength and devotion.

main_characters.name: Ravana
main_characters.role: King of Lanka, symbol of ego and adharma.

important_places.name: Mithila
important_places.desc: King Janaka’s kingdom, birthplace of Sita.

timeline.desc: Rama is born to King Dasharatha in Ayodhya.
Rama goes to forest for 14 years.
Rama defeats Ravana and rescues Sita.
Rama rules Ayodhya with justice and peace.

slokas.sanskrit: तपःस्वाध्यायनिरतं तपस्वी वाग्विदां वरम् नारदं परिपप्रच्छ वाल्मीकिर्मुनिपुङ्गवम् ॥ 1 ॥
slokas.english: Engaged in penance and study, a sage among eloquent scholars, Valmiki asked the sage Narada.

slokas.sanskrit: कोऽन्वस्मिन्साम्प्रतं लोके गुणवान् कश्च वीर्यवान् धर्मज्ञश्च कृतज्ञश्च सत्यवाक्यो दृढव्रतः ॥ 2 ॥
slokas.english: Who, in this world today, is endowed with virtues, valor, knowledge of dharma, gratitude, truthfulness, and firm vows?

slokas.sanskrit: चारित्रेण च को युक्तः सर्वभूतेषु को हितः विद्वान् कः कः समर्थश्च कश्चैकप्रियदर्शनः ॥ 3 ॥
slokas.english: Who is of good character, beneficial to all beings, learned, capable, and dear to those who see him?

slokas.sanskrit: आत्मवान् को जितक्रोधो द्युतिमान् कोऽनसूयकः कस्य बिभ्यति देवाश्च जातरोषस्य संयुगे ॥ 4 ॥
slokas.english: Who is self-controlled, victorious over anger, luminous, free from envy, and before whom even gods tremble in battle?

slokas.sanskrit: एतदिच्छाम्यहं श्रोतुं परं कौतूहलं हि मे महर्षे त्वं समर्थोऽसि ज्ञातुमेवंविधं नरम् ॥ 5 ॥
slokas.english: I desire to hear this, for it is deeply curious to me. Great sage, you are capable of describing such a man.

slokas.sanskrit: श्रुत्वा चैतत्रिलोकज्ञो वाल्मीकेर्नारदो वचः श्रूयतामिति चामन्त्र्य प्रहृष्टो वाक्यमब्रवीत् ॥ 6 ॥
slokas.english: Hearing this, Narada, knower of the three worlds, joyfully said, 'Let it be heard,' and spoke the words.

slokas.sanskrit: बहवो दुर्लभाश्चैव ये त्वया कीर्तिताः गुणाः मुने वक्ष्याम्यहं बुद्ध्वा तैर्युक्तः श्रूयतां नरः ॥ 7 ॥
slokas.english: O sage, many rare virtues have been ascribed to him. I will speak upon hearing them, so that the man may be heard of.

slokas.sanskrit: इक्ष्वाकुवंशप्रभवो रामो नाम जनैः श्रुतः नियतात्मा महावीर्यो द्युतिमान् धृतिमान् वशी ॥ 8 ॥
slokas.english: Born in the Ikshvaku dynasty and renowned by people as Rama, he is of steadfast mind, heroic, radiant, resolute, and self-mastered.

slokas.sanskrit: बुद्धिमान् नीतिमान् वाग्मी श्रीमान् शत्रुनिबर्हणः विपुलांसो महाबाहुः कम्बुग्रीवो महाहनुः ॥ 9 ॥
slokas.english: He is wise, of good conduct, eloquent, glorious, destroyer of enemies, with full limbs, great-armed, long-necked, and large-jawed.

slokas.sanskrit: महोरस्को महेष्वासो गूढजत्रुररिन्दमः आजानुबाहुः सुशिराः सुललाटः सुविक्रमः ॥ 10 ॥
slokas.english: He has a mighty forehead, majestic bearing, hidden jaws that terrify foes, broad arms, fine neck, smooth forehead, and great prowess.

slokas.sanskrit: महोरस्को महेष्वासो गूढजत्रुररिन्दमः। आजानुबाहुः सुशिराः सुललाटः सुविक्रमः॥
slokas.english: He has a broad chest, a mighty bow, hidden collarbones, arms reaching his knees, a fine head, smooth forehead, and great prowess.

slokas.sanskrit: समः समविभक्ताङ्गः स्निग्धवर्णः प्रतापवान्। पीनवक्षाः विशालाक्षो लक्ष्मणानुगतो वशी॥
slokas.english: His limbs are well-proportioned, his complexion is pleasing, he is radiant, broad-chested, large-eyed, and accompanied by Lakshmana.

slokas.sanskrit: धर्मज्ञः सत्यसन्धश्च प्रजाहितरतो वशी। यशस्वी ज्ञानसम्पन्नः शुचिर्वश्यः समाधिमान्॥
slokas.english: He knows dharma, is truthful, devoted to the welfare of people, glorious, wise, pure, self-controlled, and steadfast in meditation.

slokas.sanskrit: प्रजापतिसमः श्रीमान् धाता रिपुनिषूदनः। रक्षिता जीवलोकस्य धर्मस्य परिरक्षकः॥
slokas.english: He is equal to Prajapati, glorious, a sustainer, destroyer of foes, protector of living beings, and guardian of dharma.

slokas.sanskrit: रक्षिता स्वस्य धर्मस्य स्वजनस्य च रक्षिता। वेदवेदाङ्गतत्त्वज्ञो धनुर्वेदे च निश्रितः॥
slokas.english: He protects his own dharma and his people, knows the essence of the Vedas and Vedangas, and is skilled in the science of archery.

slokas.sanskrit: सर्वशास्त्रार्थतत्त्वज्ञः स्मृतिमान् प्रतिभानवान्। सर्वलोकप्रियः साधुरदीनात्मा विचक्षणः॥
slokas.english: He knows the essence of all scriptures, is mindful, intelligent, beloved by all, noble, fearless, and wise.

slokas.sanskrit: सर्वदाभिगतः सद्भिः समुद्र इव सिन्धुभिः। आर्यः सर्वसमः शान्तः समृद्धः सर्वधर्मविद्॥
slokas.english: He is always approached by the virtuous, like the ocean by rivers; noble, impartial, calm, prosperous, and knower of all dharmas.

slokas.sanskrit: एवं गुणगणैर्युक्तः सदा रामः प्रियतः स्वयम्। सत्यसन्धः परं धर्मं धर्मात्मा सदा स्थितः॥
slokas.english: Thus endowed with these virtues, Rama is always dear, truthful, and firmly established in supreme dharma.

slokas.sanskrit: सर्वभूतहितः श्रीमान् लोकानां हितकाम्यया। सर्वभूतानुकम्पी च धर्मज्ञः सत्यविक्रमः॥
slokas.english: He seeks the welfare of all beings, is glorious, compassionate, knows dharma, and is truly heroic.

slokas.sanskrit: एवं गुणगणैर्युक्तः रामो राजीवलोचनः। सर्वलोकप्रियः साधुः सर्वधर्मविदां वरः॥
slokas.english: Thus Rama, lotus-eyed, endowed with virtues, beloved by all, noble, and foremost among those who know dharma.

slokas.sanskrit: सत्यधर्मपरः शूरः सर्वशास्त्रविशारदः। सर्वलोकप्रियः साधुः सर्वधर्मविदां वरः॥
slokas.english: He is devoted to truth and dharma, heroic, well-versed in all scriptures, beloved by all, noble, and foremost among those who know dharma.

slokas.sanskrit: सर्वभूतहितः श्रीमान् लोकानां हितकाम्यया। सर्वभूतानुकम्पी च धर्मज्ञः सत्यविक्रमः॥
slokas.english: He seeks the welfare of all beings, is glorious, compassionate, knows dharma, and is truly heroic.

slokas.sanskrit: एवं गुणगणैर्युक्तः सदा रामः प्रियतः स्वयम्। सत्यसन्धः परं धर्मं धर्मात्मा सदा स्थितः॥
slokas.english: Thus endowed with these virtues, Rama is always dear, truthful, and firmly established in supreme dharma.

slokas.sanskrit: सर्वदाभिगतः सद्भिः समुद्र इव सिन्धुभिः। आर्यः सर्वसमः शान्तः समृद्धः सर्वधर्मविद्॥

slokas.sanskrit: सर्वशास्त्रार्थतत्त्वज्ञः स्मृतिमान् प्रतिभानवान्। सर्वलोकप्रियः साधुरदीनात्मा विचक्षणः॥

slokas.sanskrit: सर्वभूतहितः श्रीमान् लोकानां हितकाम्यया। सर्वभूतानुकम्पी च धर्मज्ञः सत्यविक्रमः॥ 32 ॥

slokas.sanskrit: सर्वशास्त्रार्थतत्त्वज्ञः स्मृतिमान् प्रतिभानवान्। सर्वलोकप्रियः साधुरदीनात्मा विचक्षणः॥ 55 ॥
slokas.english: He knows the essence of all scriptures, is mindful, intelligent, beloved by all, noble, fearless, and wise.

slokas.sanskrit: रक्षिता स्वस्य धर्मस्य स्वजनस्य च रक्षिता। वेदवेदाङ्गतत्त्वज्ञो धनुर्वेदे च निश्रितः॥ 56 ॥
slokas.english: He protects his own dharma and his people, knows the essence of the Vedas and Vedangas, and is skilled in the science of archery.

slokas.sanskrit: प्रजापतिसमः श्रीमान् धाता रिपुनिषूदनः। रक्षिता जीवलोकस्य धर्मस्य परिरक्षकः॥ 57 ॥
slokas.english: He is equal to Prajapati, glorious, a sustainer, destroyer of foes, protector of living beings, and guardian of dharma.

slokas.sanskrit: धर्मज्ञः सत्यसन्धश्च प्रजाहितरतो वशी। यशस्वी ज्ञानसम्पन्नः शुचिर्वश्यः समाधिमान्॥ 58 ॥
slokas.english: He knows dharma, is truthful, devoted to the welfare of people, glorious, wise, pure, self-controlled, and steadfast in meditation.

slokas.sanskrit: समः समविभक्ताङ्गः स्निग्धवर्णः प्रतापवान्। पीनवक्षाः विशालाक्षो लक्ष्मणानुगतो वशी॥ 59 ॥
slokas.english: His limbs are well-proportioned, his complexion is pleasing, he is radiant, broad-chested, large-eyed, and accompanied by Lakshmana.

slokas.sanskrit: महोरस्को महेष्वासो गूढजत्रुररिन्दमः। आजानुबाहुः सुशिराः सुललाटः सुविक्रमः॥ 60 ॥
slokas.english: He has a broad chest, a mighty bow, hidden collarbones, arms reaching his knees, a fine head, smooth forehead, and great prowess.

slokas.sanskrit: सत्यधर्मपरः शूरः सर्वशास्त्रविशारदः। सर्वलोकप्रियः साधुः सर्वधर्मविदां वरः॥ 61 ॥
slokas.english: He is devoted to truth and dharma, heroic, well-versed in all scriptures, beloved by all, noble, and foremost among those who know dharma.

slokas.sanskrit: सर्वभूतहितः श्रीमान् लोकानां हितकाम्यया। सर्वभूतानुकम्पी च धर्मज्ञः सत्यविक्रमः॥ 62 ॥
slokas.english: He seeks the welfare of all beings, is glorious, compassionate, knows dharma, and is truly heroic.

slokas.sanskrit: एवं गुणगणैर्युक्तः सदा रामः प्रियतः स्वयम्। सत्यसन्धः परं धर्मं धर्मात्मा सदा स्थितः॥ 63 ॥
slokas.english: Thus endowed with these virtues, Rama is always dear, truthful, and firmly established in supreme dharma.

slokas.sanskrit: सर्वदाभिगतः सद्भिः समुद्र इव सिन्धुभिः। आर्यः सर्वसमः शान्तः समृद्धः सर्वधर्मविद्॥ 64 ॥
slokas.english: He is always approached by the virtuous, like the ocean by rivers; noble, impartial, calm, prosperous, and knower of all dharmas.

slokas.sanskrit: सर्वशास्त्रार्थतत्त्वज्ञः स्मृतिमान् प्रतिभानवान्। सर्वलोकप्रियः साधुरदीनात्मा विचक्षणः॥ 65 ॥
